class.name: EnhancedMaterialFactory
class.summary: Class dedicated to handling processing and data storage / retrieval.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the Material Factory.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.Clear
member.summary: Clears the Material Factory and all of its data.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.LoadExposedShaderProperties
member.summary: Finds and saves all of the exposed Material properties into the Material Factory.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.TryGetPropertyID(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to locate a Shader Property ID correlating to the String key.
member.param: The property ID. Will return -1 if not found.
member.returns: Returns a Boolean and Int32 Value.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.GetPropertyID(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a Shader Property ID correlated to the string key.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.GetPropertyIDS
member.summary:
Get all Exposed Property ID's within every Material in the project.
This generates a new array, as such it isnt entirely efficient so use at your own risk.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.GetPropertyNames
member.summary:
Get all Exposed Property Names within every Material in the project.
This generates a new array, as such it isnt entirely efficient so use at your own risk.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.HasStaticMaterial(System.String)
member.summary:
Checks whether the Factory contains an instance of the Static Material with the specified name.
This will only be useful if you generate Materials outside of the Factory.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.FindStaticMaterial(UnityEngine.Material)
member.summary:
Checks whether the Factory contains an instance of the Static Material with the same name as the Material and returns it.
This will likely be marked as Obsolete soon so don't rely on it too much.
member.param: The Material which is used to find the instance.
member.returns: Returns an Instance of the Asset Material with the corresponding name.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.FindStaticMaterial(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the Factory contains an instance of the Static Material using the specified key.
member.param: The key which is used to find the instance.
member.returns: Returns an Instance of the Asset Material with the corresponding name.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.FindMasterMaterial(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the Factory contains an instance of the Master Material using the specified key.
member.param: The key which is used to find the instance.
member.returns: Returns the Instance of the Material with the corresponding name.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.GenerateInstanceMaterial(UnityEngine.Material)
member.summary: Generates a new material instance. Currently just a dumb wrapper function.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.GenerateMasterMaterial(UnityEngine.Material,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a Master Material within the Factory which can be used as a static (shared) Material.
member.param: The Material to create an instance of.
The key which is used to find the instance.
member.returns: Returns an Instance of the Material specified.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.CleanupInstances
member.summary: This will clear any and all references to Instance and Instanced Asset Materials held within the Material Factory.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.LoadMaterials
member.summary: This will load all the Materials in the project (Including Unity defaults) into a Scriptable Object which will be used by the Material Factory.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.LoadDefaultsToContainer
member.summary: This will load all the Primitive Unity Materials into the MaterialContainer.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.LoadDefaultUnityMaterials
member.summary: This Initializes and loads all of the Primitive Unity Materials into the Unity Default Materials Dictionary.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.GenerateAssetPath
member.summary: Generates the Asset Path to store the Materials Container.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.CreateAsset(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an asset of type T.
member.remarks: T must derive from type Scriptable Object.

member.name: M:EnhancedMaterialFactory.GetCurrentRenderPipelineInUse
member.summary: Gets the current render pipeline, this operation is insanely terrible for so many reasons so do not call it unless absolutely needed.
